docs.snippet: A Massachusetts law that makes it a crime to publish false statements about political candidates is unconstitutional, the state's highest court ruled Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Massachusetts law that makes it a crime to publish false statements about political candidates is unconstitutional, the state's highest court ruled Thursday.

headline.main: Court Strikes Down Law Barring False Campaign Statements

docs.snippet: Marcus Weaver spent nearly three years talking openly about forgiving the man who shot him, killed his friend and caused untold suffering. As a Christian opposed to capital punishment, he considered forgiveness "a no-brainer" and didn't want to se...
docs.lead_paragraph: Marcus Weaver spent nearly three years talking openly about forgiving the man who shot him, killed his friend and caused untold suffering. As a Christian opposed to capital punishment, he considered forgiveness "a no-brainer" and didn't want to see the gunman executed.

headline.main: Victims Conflicted Over Death Penalty for Theater Gunman
headline.print_headline: Victims Conflicted Over Death Penalty for Theater Gunman

docs.snippet: A lawsuit by Tiffany Wilson, whose brother Sharrif was imprisoned for 22 years in the deaths of a woman and two girls, accuses the police of “egregious” misconduct....
docs.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit by Tiffany Wilson, whose brother Sharrif was imprisoned for 22 years in the deaths of a woman and two girls, accuses the police of “egregious” misconduct.
docs.abstract: Bronx woman Tiffany Wilson files suit against New York City and police officers on behalf of estate of her brother Sharrif Wilson, who died less than year after being released from prison; Sharrif Wilson had been convicted of triple murder when he was 15 years old in 1992 and, after 22 years of incarceration, had his conviction overturned based on new evidence; lawsuit aims to expose misconduct by police and problems with criminal justice system.

headline.main: Estate of Man Exonerated in 1992 Murders Sues New York City and Police
headline.print_headline: City and Police Are Sued Over a 1992 Murder Case
